intro: Erigeron leucotrichus, commonly known as whiteleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its white to pale blue flowers bloom in summer, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Erigeron leucotrichus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
